_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy: ConAgra Foods maintains a comprehensive safety, health, and environmental program at the plant. The program includes engineering, education, and enforcement provisions for hazard communication, spill prevention and response, hazardous waste, universal waste and waste oil management, waste water and storm water management.



2. Emergency Response Program: ConAgra Foods facility has developed an OSHA hazardous substance emergency action plan. The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting. Depending upon a given situation, the Fire Department will be called to provide back-up emergency responders and equipment. The Fire Department will be called for all fire related emergencies. The facility has communicated hazards of ammonia with the local Fire Department and LEPC. The incident commander has ultimate control of implementation of the emergency response plan.



3. Stationary Source and Regulated Substance: ConAgra Foods is a processing plant located at 200 Banquet Drive, Marshall, MO. The main building houses a processing plant used for manufacturing of frozen meals and processed foods. The products require refrigeration for the processing and freezing associated with the products.



4. Worst Case and Alternative Release Scenarios: RMP*Comp was used to calculate the worst case and alternative release scenarios for the process.



5. Five Year Accident History: There have been no reportable incidents during the past five years. However, the facility maintains records of all incident investigation reports regardless of anhydrous ammonia quantity released into the atmosphere.



6. Planned changes to improve safety: Based on the Process Hazardous Analysis (PHA) for anhydrous ammonia, lists of action items were developed. The status of these action items will be monitored to insure that implementation of the safety improvements is accomplished.  Monthly safety training
is conducted for all team members at this facility, in addition PSM meetings are held to review safety and PSM program elements. Refer to Process Safety Management Program for specific information.
